prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin (0, 0, 0) with no rotation. 1.1 Sketch a rectangle on the X-Y plane with the following lines: - Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.75, 0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0), End Point (0.75, 0.75) - Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.75), End Point (0, 0.75) - Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.75), End Point (0, 0) 1.2 Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 1.3 Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.75 units. This results in a rectangular prism. Part 2: Cut a Triangular Prism from the Rectangular Prism Cut a triangular prism from the rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at (0.075, 0.0286, 0.75) with no rotation. 2.1 Sketch a hexagon on the X-Y plane with the following lines: - Line 1: Start Point (0, 0.1732), End Point (0.3, 0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.3, 0), End Point (0.6, 0.1732) - Line 3: Start Point (0.6, 0.1732), End Point (0.6, 0.5196) - Line 4: Start Point (0.6, 0.5196), End Point (0.3, 0.6928) - Line 5: Start Point (0.3, 0.6928), End Point (0, 0.5196) - Line 6: Start Point (0, 0.5196), End Point (0, 0.1732) 2.2 Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6928. 2.3 Extrude the sketch along the negative Z-axis by 0.45 units, effectively cutting a triangular prism from the rectangular prism. These instructions should result in the desired CAD assembly. Keep in mind that height, width, and length values are given using the scale factors and may not represent the final dimensions. Double-check the actual dimensions after creating the CAD models.</description>

<description>**Part 1: A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center** The first part of the CAD assembly is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. We will create a new coordinate system and proceed with the following steps: 1. *Creating coordinate system* Create a new coordinate system with the euler angles as (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 2. *Drawing 2D sketch* - Begin by drawing a rectangle on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Divide the rectangle into two loops: - **Loop 1**: Draw a line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.5806, 0.0); then draw a line from point (0.5806, 0.0) to point (0.5806, 0.3387); then draw a line from point (0.5806, 0.3387) to point (0.0, 0.3387); and finally, connect the initial point (0.0, 0.3387) with the first point (0.0, 0.0) to close the loop. - **Loop 2**: At the center point (0.1452, 0.2661) of the rectangle, draw a circle with a radius of 0.0363. - Draw a second rectangle on the XY plane of the coordinate system, on top of the first rectangle. Divide this second rectangle into two loops: - **Loop 3**: Draw a line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.5806, 0.0); then draw a line from point (0.5806, 0.0) to point (0.5806, 0.0726); then draw a line from point (0.5806, 0.0726) to point (0.0, 0.0726); and finally, connect the initial point (0.0, 0.0726) with the first point (0.0, 0.0) to close the loop. - **Loop 4**: At the center point (0.4355, 0.0363) of this rectangle, draw a circle with a radius of 0.0363. 3. *Scaling 2D sketch* Scale the entire 2D sketch uniformly by a scaling factor of 0.5806 to accommodate the prism dimensions. 4. *Transforming the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch* Rotate the 2D sketch around the Z-axis of the coordinate system by no degrees, rotate the 2D sketch around the Y-axis of the coordinate system by no degrees, and rotate the 2D sketch around the X-axis of the coordinate system by no degrees. Translate the 2D sketch along the X-axis by no units, translate the 2D sketch along the Y-axis by no units, and translate the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by no units. 5. *Extruding the 2D sketch to generate 3D model* Extrude the 2D sketch along the extrusion normal with an extrusion depth of 0.0484 units. Do not perform any extrusion in the opposite direction. 6. *Finalizing part settings* As this part is added to the CAD model without any interaction with the previous parts, don't apply any boolean operation to this part. The `NewBodyFeatureOperation` operation is used to indicate this part's independence. Here are the dimensions of the intermediate CAD parts and the final CAD shape: - Part 1 dimensions: length 0.5806; width 0.5806; height 0.0484 - Final CAD shape dimensions: length - to be determined by the combination of all parts; width - to be determined by the combination of all parts; height - to be determined by the combination of all parts</description>
